summaryOfNewsArticle: A military conflict between the Republic of Korea and the People's Republic of China has escalated dramatically since April 18, 2024. The situation began with joint naval exercises between South Korea and the United States, announced on April 20, 2024. This triggered a series of military responses from China, including maritime patrols in the East China Sea starting on April 23, 2024. On April 25, South Korea deployed additional fighter jets to its western coast in response to the rising tensions. A significant aerial confrontation occurred on April 26, 2024, near the border, involving fighter jets from both South Korea and China. As of April 27, 2024, the conflict continues with ongoing military actions, heightened diplomatic tensions, and a clear escalation in the regional security environment.
title: Military Conflict Between South Korea and China Escalates Amid Joint Naval Exercises and Aerial Confrontation
